result.execSummary:
The defendant David Quince Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant. Restitution set at zero.

Seek and maintain employment.
Job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

No contact with the victim in this case, Tomariel E.
No controlled substances; no alcohol.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment; treatment if needed.
Urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Quince Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant David Quince Boyd not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Case is adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant David Quince Boyd in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant David Quince Boyd in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 5/11/15 at 8:30 a.m.  The Court vacated the final pretrial and jury trial dates.  File retained in court.

Defense counsel advised this clerk that her client wanted a plea date.  Case is scheduled for projected guilty plea before Branch 20 on 4/23/15 at 8:30 a.m.  The final pretrial and jury trial dates will remain until plea hearing is completed.  ADA Schroeder notified by e-mail; bailiffs notified to produce defendant for the earlier date.
Original PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT Transcript (9 pages) commencing MARCH 6, 2015 received and filed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant David Quince Boyd not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance and requested a trial date.  Court set the following:  any motions to be filed must be filed on or before 4/15/15; response due by 5/05/15; reply due by 5/11/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week final pretrial date.  Any alibi notices are to be filed per statute.  Same bail.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant David Quince Boyd not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested another scheduling date to go over offer with client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant David Quince Boyd in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant David Quince Boyd in custody.  Ron Dague for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective John Karlovich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to monitored by Drug Testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Tonjariel E ; Henry L; Apartment  building located at 5734 N 76th Street, Milwaukee
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Quince Boyd in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant David Quince Boyd in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
